dataModelInfo.description: COSA TR181 and extension for USGv2.

parameter.name: DNS_Override
parameter.description: This object is used to Enable or Disable DNS override. If DNS override is false (0), the DNS IP addresses assigned by the service provider will be assigned to the clients on the LAN. If DNS override is true (1), the DNS IP addresses configured by the customer (IPv4 and IPv6 ones) will be assigned to the clients on the LAN. This object will automatically reflect the status of the UI radio buttons in the DNS UI page.

parameter.name: DNS_ForceStatic
parameter.description: This object is used to enable or disable forcing the use of the configured static DNS servers. If DNS ForceStatic is true (1), the gateway MUST only forward DNS requests and replies that have a source or destination address that is equal one of the configured custom DNS server addresses. If DNS ForceStatic is false (0), the gateway will not block DNS traffic, unless configured to do so through other configuration.

parameter.name: DNS_IPv4Preferred
parameter.description: Preferred IPv4 DNS server

parameter.name: DNS_IPv4Alternate
parameter.description: Alternate IPv4 DNS server

parameter.name: DNS_IPv6Preferred
parameter.description: Preferred IPv6 DNS server

parameter.name: DNS_IPv6Alternate
parameter.description: Alternate IPv6 DNS server

parameter.name: ErouterModeControl
parameter.description: When this object is set to ipDisabled(1), the eRouter is instructed to transparently bridge all traffic and can overrule TLV202. When this object is set to ipv4Only(2), the eRouter is instructed to switch to IPv4 Protocol Enabled Mode and can overrule TLV202. When this object is set to ipv6Only(3), the eRouter is instructed to switch to IPv6 Protocol Enabled Mode and can overrule TLV202. When this object is set to ipv4AndIpv6(4), the eRouter is instructed to switch to Dual IP Protocol Enabled Mode and can overrule TLV202. When this object is set to honoreRouterInitMode(5), the eRouter is instructed to honor the eRouter Initialization Mode Encoding encapsulated in the eCM Config File underTLV 202.

parameter.name: IPv6LeaseTimeRemaining
parameter.description: DHCPv6 lease time remaining in seconds. A value of -1 indicates an infinite lease. The value MUST be 0 (zero) if the AddressSource is not DHCP.

parameter.name: HideCustomerDhcpLanChange
parameter.description: To hide the functionality for customer to choose their own private IPv4 network when set to True

parameter.name: HideSmartWifiSection
parameter.description: To hide the Smart Wi-Fi section on Wireless Signal page if set to True.

parameter.name: FirstInstallWizardEnable
parameter.description: Whether the First Install Wizard is offered upon First Install. If Cloud UI is enabled, the local First Install Wizard cannot be active.

parameter.name: FirstInstallState
parameter.description: Whether the modem is in First Install state. Once First Install wizard is completed modem is no longer in First Install state

parameter.name: TroubleshootWizardEnable
parameter.description: Toggle local troubleshooting UI designed for cloud UI solution when modem/eRouter is disconnected from Internet. HTTP sessions are redirected to this page.

parameter.name: CAppName
parameter.description: Corresponds to the string (Country_C-App_Name) on the Local Troubleshooting page of the Cloud UI. If set to an empty string the entire line for the download instructions MUST NOT be displayed.

parameter.name: WebsiteHelpURL
parameter.description: Corresponds to the string (Country_Care_website_Help_URL) on the Local Troubleshooting page of the Cloud UI. If set to an empty string the entire line for the help pages MUST NOT be displayed.

parameter.name: DataModelVersion
parameter.description: A number used to control the version of the Liberty DataModel definition. Any update Liberty applies to its CPE data model will be reflected by a change of this number. The CPE device MUST show the version number of the definition used for implementation. The number format can be: [major].[minor].[patch]

parameter.name: DataModelSpecification
parameter.description: The CPE device MUST show the version number of the Liberty DataModel Specification. The number format can be: [major].[minor].[patch]

parameter.name: DSErrorConditionTimer
parameter.description: This timer describes the time in seconds after which the LED should display an error condition if Booting stage 3, DS scanning, has not completed inside the configured period.

parameter.name: USErrorConditionTimer
parameter.description: This timer describes the time in seconds after which the LED should display an error condition if Booting stage 4, US scanning, has not completed inside the configured period.

parameter.name: RegistrationErrorConditionTimer
parameter.description: This timer describes the time in seconds after which the LED should display an error condition if Booting stage 5, Registration (DHCP/TFTP), has not completed inside the configured period.

parameter.name: SONAdminStatus
parameter.description: PLUME Control SON Admin Status Data Model

parameter.name: SONOperationalStatus
parameter.description: PLUME Control SON Operational Status Data Model

parameter.name: SONURL
parameter.description: TR181 object to set Plume Cloud URL. Syntax follow this example: ssl:hostname:port. Example would be “ssl:cuillin.plumenet.io:443”.

parameter.name: SONDFSEnable
parameter.description: PLUME Control SON DFS Enable Data Model

parameter.name: SONMeshEnabled
parameter.description: PLUME Control SON Mesh Enable Data Model

parameter.name: SONLogpullEnable
parameter.description: Enable/Disable PLUME Logpull functionality

parameter.name: NativeAtmBsControl
parameter.description: When set to False(0), ONLY Plume level 1 (Channel Optimisation) is active on the device or the Plume agent is completely disabled. When set to True(1), levels 2 and/or 3 are also active. This is a control object and is not being actively reported by the CPE.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Parameter to set/get the iperf test state

parameter.name: Command
parameter.description: Parameter to specify the entire set of command line options that are passed to the iperf application.

parameter.name: Result
parameter.description: Parameter to store the latest iperf

parameter.name: ConnectionTimeout
parameter.description: Parameter to define the length of time the iperf client will wait without receiving a response before the connection is determined to have timed out.

parameter.name: PeakCPUUsage
parameter.description: Parameter to store the peak CPU usage as a percentage measured over the full duration of the previous successfully completed iperf test. If no test has been successfully completed, this parameter should return an empty value when read. It is expected that this be applied to both client and server modes of iperf operation.

parameter.name: AverageCPUUsage
parameter.description: Parameter to store the average (mean) CPU usage as a percentage measured over the full duration of the previous successfully completed iperf test. If no test has been successfully completed, this parameter should return an empty value when read. It is expected that this be applied to both client and server modes of iperf operation.

parameter.name: X_LGI-COM_SerialNumber
parameter.description: Serial number of of the device. The standard {{param|SerialNumber}} parameter may reflect the eRouter MAC address but this parameter will always reflect the actual manufacturing serial number.

parameter.name: X_LGI-COM_ShowDNSConfigPage
parameter.description: This object allows to configure if the DNS configuration page will be visible or hidden to the customer.

parameter.name: ScheduleEnable
parameter.description: Schedules for MAC filtering rules to be active. - Always: filtering always active - ByHour: filtering active by hour every day - ByDayHour: filtering active by Day and Hour.

parameter.name: BlockTimeBitMask
parameter.description: A bitmask that sets the time of day and days of the week to apply this rule. This must be stored in bit format and not hex. The indices for the days of the week have 1-7 corresponding to Sunday-Saturday. The bitmask has the following representation: b23b22b21b20b19b18b17b16b15b14b13b12b11b10b9b8b7b6b5b4b3b2b1b0 where b0 for example is "bit 0". - Bits 0-23 apply to hours of the day 00:00:00-23:00:00. Each bit corresponds to an hour. 0th bit-hour0-1,1st bit-hour1-2 and so on. Set the bit high to enable the rule for specified hour. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (Always), all bits for all days are set to high. Bits: 111111111111111111111111. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (Byhour), the 1st index of DayOfWeek indicates the hours enabled for all days of the week. Write is allowed only for the 1st index. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (ByDayHour): Write is allowed for all indices of DayOfWeek.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Rule enabled/disabled

parameter.name: Hostname
parameter.description: Host name of device

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of device

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables/disables IPv4 firewall

parameter.name: ScheduleEnable
parameter.description: Schedules for IPv4 filtering rules to be active. - Always: filtering always active - ByHour: filtering active by hour every day - ByDayHour: filtering active by Day and Hour.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable/disable IP filtering rule

parameter.name: SrcStartAddr
parameter.description: Beginning of source IP range

parameter.name: SrcEndAddr
parameter.description: End of source IP range (the address is not contrained by a binary mask length)

parameter.name: DstStartAddr
parameter.description: Beginning of destination IP range

parameter.name: DstEndAddr
parameter.description: End of source destination range (the address is not contrained by a binary mask length)

parameter.name: SrcPortStart
parameter.description: Beginning of source port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: SrcPortEnd
parameter.description: End of source port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: DstPortStart
parameter.description: Beginning of destination port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: DstPortEnd
parameter.description: End of destination port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: Which protocols are filtered

parameter.name: Direction
parameter.description: Whether IP filtering rule is applied to inbound or outbound packets

parameter.name: Action
parameter.description: Whether rule allows or denies (drops) access

parameter.name: BlockTimeBitMask
parameter.description: A bitmask that sets the time of day and days of the week to apply this rule. This must be stored in bit format and not hex. The indices for the days of the week have 1-7 corresponding to Sunday-Saturday. The bitmask has the following representation: b23b22b21b20b19b18b17b16b15b14b13b12b11b10b9b8b7b6b5b4b3b2b1b0 where b0 for example is "bit 0". - Bits 0-23 apply to hours of the day 00:00:00-23:00:00. Each bit corresponds to an hour. 0th bit-hour0-1,1st bit-hour1-2 and so on. Set the bit high to enable the rule for specified hour. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (Always), all bits for all days are set to high. Bits: 111111111111111111111111. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (Byhour), the 1st index of DayOfWeek indicates the hours enabled for all days of the week. Write is allowed only for the 1st index. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (ByDayHour): Write is allowed for all indices of DayOfWeek.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables/disables IPv6 firewall

parameter.name: ScheduleEnable
parameter.description: Schedules for IPv6 filtering rules to be active. - Always: filtering always active - ByHour: filtering active by hour every day - ByDayHour: filtering active by Day and Hour.

parameter.name: SrcStartAddr
parameter.description: Beginning of source IP range

parameter.name: SrcPortStart
parameter.description: Beginning of source port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: SrcPortEnd
parameter.description: End of source port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: Which protocols are filtered

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable/disable IP filtering rule

parameter.name: Direction
parameter.description: Whether IP filtering rule is applied to inbound or outbound packets

parameter.name: IPv6SrcPrefixLen
parameter.description: Specifies prefix for source IPv6 range

parameter.name: DstStartAddr
parameter.description: End of source IP range

parameter.name: IPv6DstPrefixLen
parameter.description: Specifies prefix for destination IPv6 range

parameter.name: DstPortStart
parameter.description: Beginning of destination port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: DstPortEnd
parameter.description: End of destination port range (0..65535), where 0 is undefined

parameter.name: Action
parameter.description: Whether rule allows or denies (drops) access

parameter.name: BlockTimeBitMask
parameter.description: A bitmask that sets the time of day and days of the week to apply this rule. This must be stored in bit format and not hex. The indices for the days of the week have 1-7 corresponding to Sunday-Saturday. The bitmask has the following representation: b23b22b21b20b19b18b17b16b15b14b13b12b11b10b9b8b7b6b5b4b3b2b1b0 where b0 for example is "bit 0". - Bits 0-23 apply to hours of the day 00:00:00-23:00:00. Each bit corresponds to an hour. 0th bit-hour0-1,1st bit-hour1-2 and so on. Set the bit high to enable the rule for specified hour. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (Always), all bits for all days are set to high. Bits: 111111111111111111111111. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (Byhour), the 1st index of DayOfWeek indicates the hours enabled for all days of the week. Write is allowed only for the 1st index. - When ScheduleEnable is set to (ByDayHour): Write is allowed for all indices of DayOfWeek.

parameter.name: X_LGI-COM_ClearLanAllowedSubnetTable
parameter.description: Clear all the entries in LanAllowedSubnetTable

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: Instance aliasing object for LanAllowedSubnetTable

parameter.name: X_LGI-COM_MaxClients
parameter.description: Maximum number of DHCP clients allowed

parameter.name: X_RDK-COM_Enable
parameter.description: Enables/disables DDNS.

parameter.name: Level
parameter.type: string: Emergency(1), Alert(2), Critical(3), Error(4), Warning(5), Notice(6), Informational(7), Debug(8)

parameter.name: Level
parameter.type: string: Emergency(1), Alert(2), Critical(3), Error(4), Warning(5), Notice(6), Informational(7), Debug(8)

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: WoL/WoWLAN Target MAC. When set, this immediately triggers WoL transmission and initiates a background WoL schedule only if there are no currently running schedules for the same MAC and there is a free slot for the schedule. The value of this parameter is not part of the device configuration and is always the empty string when read.

parameter.name: Interval
parameter.description: Time interval between scheduled magic packets. (units: ms) (default=500)

parameter.name: Retries
parameter.description: Number of scheduled magic packets to send. (default=3)

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables LAN Multicast support

parameter.name: SnoopingEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables IGMP/MLD snooping on all its customer-facing interfaces (primary LAN, WiFi backhaul interfaces, Ethernet, Guest WiFi) When enabled it prevents unnecessary multicast traffic to the ports which did not subscribe to the multicast stream.

parameter.name: IGMPv3ProxyEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables IGMPv3 proxy functionality

parameter.name: MLDv2ProxyEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables MLDv2 proxy functionality

parameter.name: SSMForwardingEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables routing of subscribed SSM traffic from WAN to LAN interfaces

parameter.name: MaxSSMSessions
parameter.description: This parameter is used to configure maximum number of SSM sessions that could be subscribed to by client devices on the LAN

parameter.name: M2UMaxSessions
parameter.description: The parameter is used to configure the maximum number of simultaneous WiFi M2U forwarding sessions. The parameter value when set to 0 means M2U forwarding is disabled.

parameter.name: MaxThrottlingRate
parameter.description: After receiving a given number of IGMP/MLD messages per second per interface, the CPE should stop processing and discard IGMP/MLD messages for a certain duration to protect and avoid against IGMP/MLD waterfalls towards LAN and/or WAN networks. 0 means throttling is disabled. default is 32.

parameter.name: MaxThrottlingHoldTime
parameter.description: After receiving a given number of IGMP/MLD messages per second per interface, the CPE should stop processing and discard IGMP/MLD messages for a certain duration to protect and avoid against IGMP/MLD waterfalls towards LAN and/or WAN networks. 0 means hold time is disabled. default is 10.

parameter.name: FastLeaveEnable
parameter.description: When Fast Leave is enabled, the internal logical or physical layer-2 interface immediately stops forwarding multicast traffic for a multicast group when the last listener client for a multicast group or channel on the interface sends a leave message for that group or channel.
